legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
title: E-commerce

list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK (including foreign owned businesses) unless otherwise stated. The UK consists of England, Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland and excludes the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures arenâ€™t available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

content.title: Read the detailed guidance for completing the survey

content.description: Include information on percentage of people in the business who use computers.
Include information on employment and training of ICT specialists.

questions.question: Access and Use of the Internet

content.description: Include information on percentage of people in the business who use computers, type of connection and download speed, use of portable devices, website, and social media.

questions.question: Sharing of Information Electronically within the Business

content.description: Include information on use of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software within the business.
Include information on ICT security procedures, training, documentation, policies and issues.
Include information on percentage of turnover that comes from online orders and where these orders originate from.
Read more information about this survey

list: You cannot appeal your selection. Your business was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.
The information you provide is used to measure how businesses are adopting new technology and engaging in e-commerce, as part of the digital economy.

blocks.title: Sharing of Information Electronically within the Business
blocks.description: This section covers the businessâ€™ use of business software.

questions.title: Does {{ first_non_empty_item(metadata['trad_as'], metadata['ru_name']) }} use an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software package?

content.description: One or a set of software applications that integrate information and processes across several functions within the business, e.g. planning, procurement, sales, marketing, customer relations, finance, or human resources.

questions.title: Does {{ first_non_empty_item(metadata['trad_as'], metadata['ru_name']) }} use Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software to collect, store and make information available about customers with other internal systems?

content.description: A management methodology based on an intensive use of information technologies to collect, integrate, process, and analyse information related to customers.
list: Operational CRM - Integrates the front office business processes that are in contact with the customer.
Analytical CRM - Analysis, through data mining, of the information available in the business about its customers. This aims to gather in-depth knowledge of the customer and customerâ€™s needs.

questions.title: Does the business use CRM software to analyse information about customers for marketing purposes?
questions.description: For example setting prices, sales promotion, choosing distribution channels etc.

blocks.title: ICT Security
blocks.description: The next section covers ICT security.

questions.title: Which ICT security measures does {{ first_non_empty_item(metadata['trad_as'], metadata['ru_name']) }} use?

definitions.title: Definition of ICT (Information and Communication Technology)

content.description: Technology that provides access to information through telecommunications. It is similar to Information Technology (IT), but focuses primarily on communication technologies. This includes the internet, wireless networks, mobile phones, and other communication media.

options.label: Strong password authentication
options.description: For example a minimum length of 8 mixed (alpha and numeric) characters, periodic change.

options.label: User identification and authentication via biometric methods implemented in the business
options.value: User identification and authentication via biometric methods implemented in the business
options.description: For example based on fingerprints, voices, faces

options.label: Encryption techniques for data, documents or email
options.value: Encryption techniques for data, documents or email

options.label: Access control to business network
options.description: For example management of user rights

options.label: VPN (Virtual Private Network)
options.description: This extends a private network across a public network to enable secure exchange of data over public network

when.value: User identification and authentication via biometric methods implemented in the business
Encryption techniques for data, documents or email

questions.description: {{ format_unordered_list_missing_items(['Strong password authentication', 'User identification and authentication via biometric methods implemented in the business', 'Encryption techniques for data, documents or email', 'Access control to business network', 'VPN (Virtual Private Network)'], answers['answer1861']) }}

questions.title: Does the business have documentation on measures, practices, or procedures for ICT security?

content.description: Documents on ICT security and confidentiality of data cover employee training in ICT use, ICT security measures, the evaluation of ICT security measures, plans for updating ICT security documents etc.

questions.title: When was {{ first_non_empty_item(metadata['trad_as'], metadata['ru_name']) }}â€™s ICT security policy defined or most recently reviewed?
questions.description: For example, risk assessment, evaluation of ICT security incidents etc.

options.label: More than 12 months ago and up to 24 months ago
options.value: More than 12 months ago and up to 24 months ago

questions.title: During 2018, did any ICT security issues result in the unavailability of ICT services?
questions.description: For example, denial of service attacks, ransomware attacks, hardware or software failures excluding mechanical failures, theft

questions.title: During 2018, did any ICT security issues result in the destruction or corruption of data?
questions.description: For example, due to infection by malicious software or unauthorised intrusion, hardware or software failures.

questions.title: During 2018, did any ICT security issues result in the disclosure of confidential data?
questions.description: For example, due to intrusion, pharming or phishing attacks, actions by own employees (intentionally or unintentionally).

questions.title: Does {{ first_non_empty_item(metadata['trad_as'], metadata['ru_name']) }} have insurance covering ICT security risks, threats, or incidents?

content.description: E-commerce is the sale or purchase of goods or services conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of receiving or placing of orders.
The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.
E-commerce transactions exclude orders made by manually typed emails.
